summary: The Washington Monument is a huge stone tower in Washington, D.C., honoring George Washington, the first U.S. president. It's the world's tallest stone structure and obelisk, standing at 554 feet. The monument is made of different types of marble and granite. Its construction started in 1848 but was paused for many years due to money issues and the Civil War. It was finally completed in 1888. Inside, there are stairs and an elevator, and the top has windows and lights. The monument has been closed a few times for repairs and safety checks.
title: Washington Monument
